result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Skinner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Vehicle w/o Consent-Passenger [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(4m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $548.15, joint and several, payable to Kyleenne J.  Restitution to be collected by D.O.C. Failure to pay by the end of supervision of 13CF5598 will result in a civil judgment.

Pay $200.00 DNA surcharge, to be collected by D.O.C. failure to pay by the end of supervision of 13CF5598 will result in a civil judgment.
Court waives all other costs, fees and surcharges due to indigency.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J. Skinner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Filed, Crime Victim Impact Statement. Statements by parties.  
Defendant ordereed to serve 6 months in the House of Correctoin concurrent to any other sentence with credit of 94 days times served.  
Court orders defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $548.15, joint and several, payable to Kyleenne J.  Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision of 13CF5598 will result in a civil judgment.  
Defendant to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge, to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision of 13CF5598 will result in a civil judgment. 
Court WAIVES all other costs, fees and surcharges due to indegency.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael J. Skinner in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Michael J. Skinner in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.
